direction.raw_text: we PAN DOWN a hallway full of COLLEGE KIDS. They carry boxes, stereo speakers, stand around chatting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gets out of a taxi in front of a dorm. She's pretty, with optimistic eyes and brown hair cut just above her shoulders. She's dressed casually, but still chic. No parents. She carries a backpack on one shoulder, a duffle bag on the other, and a huge suitcase in her hand. And she's staring through the building's window at... Newly-minted COLLEGE STUDENTS milling about inside. Their parents in tow, pride and sadness mingled in their faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara walks to the registration table. A RESIDENT ASSISTANT smiles up at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Sara Matthews. She looks her up in the computer. She plays with a simple silver chain around her neck. R.A. Des Moines, Iowa. Wow. Flyover country. She says it nicely, but it still stings. Sara smiles gamely. R.A. You're in room three-sixteen. Welcome. She hands Sara a room key. She fingers it, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara as she... Pushes an ancient, flat-bed cart out of the elevator and down the hall, struggling to control its wobbly wheels. She bumps into other carts, but everyone just laughs it off. Sara stops in front of Room 316.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She opens the door and looks in on: A run-of-the-mill freshman dorm room. Tiny; bathroom down the hall; twin beds. Heaven. Sara steps in. She looks at the two empty beds. Big choice here. She drops her stuff on the bed by the window. She sits down on it. A beat. I'm really here. First things first -- Sara takes a framed picture out of her duffle bag and sets it on the dresser. It's a picture of a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: maybe ten. She looks a little like Sara. Sara hauls a white, Styrofoam DESIGN MANNEQUIN off the cart. It's full of pin and chalk marks. She sets it by her bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Told you we'd make it. She steps back to the doorway. As she hauls her suitcase off the cart... BOOM! Another cart slams into hers. A box tumbles off the other cart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry! Bad driver. Sara kneels to help the other girl -- cute, frizzy hair -- clean up the mess. A slew of clothes lie on the carpet. And peeking out from under them... a bottle of vodka. The girl smiles sheepishly.

direction.raw_text: In case of emergency. (BEAT) I'm Tracy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Balancing boxes, they manage to shake hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara's cell phone buzzes. She answers it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Yeah, it's amazing here. I met this really cool biker? He's taking me to Mexico this weekend. (BEAT) Hello? (BEAT) Hi, Mom. Just tell him I'm kidding. Sara stops in front of the campus coffee shop. She eyes a work/study ad on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything's great. (BEAT) No, she's not here yet so I got to choose my side of the room. She tears a tab off the flyer.

direction.raw_text: Sara's half-settled in now. The wall beside her bed is peppered with fashion pages ripped out of Vogue and In Style. She sits in a lounge chair, paging through a Vanity Fair photo shoot. She spots a cool outfit and tears out the page.

direction.raw_text: . Sara walks over. She opens it expectantly to see...

direction.raw_text: I don't know... I might just hang and wait for my roommate. Groans all around. "Come on"... "Lame-O"... Sara bites her lip, considering. She smiles.

direction.raw_text: Alright. Just let me change. The girls cheer.

direction.raw_text: . FRAT HOUSE - NIGHT Sara, Tracy, Kim and the others from the floor are at the head of the line, stepping into the house. They're met by a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a frat party?! Seriously? He holds up a handful of ugly lime-green wristbands. Kim steps around him.

direction.raw_text: I don't drink anyway. Tracy looks at her, mouth agape.

direction.raw_text: There's punch and non-alcoholic beer over there... He points to a table with a giant bowl and cups. No one is around it. Tracy tries to flirt with the bouncer.

direction.raw_text: Come on, just us. We won't tell. The bouncer is tempted but not budging.

direction.raw_text: Honestly, I'm just a pledge. They'll kick me out. She stomps by him.

direction.raw_text: Wuss. Defeated, Tracy walks over to the table. Turns back to Sara.

direction.raw_text: You want something to drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the point? Tracy huffs as Sara walks into A SEA OF KIDS. We're talking extreme fire hazard... extreme moral hazard. Sara moves through the crowd. Her clothes are low-wattage, but stylish. She's drawn to the music coming from a large room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on stage. They're not very good, but they don't care. Sara finds a spot along the wall and watches them. In particular -- THE DRUMMER. A cute goof, spastically whaling away. He's mouthing the lyrics, eyes closed. Really into it. Sara chuckles at the sight, not taking her eyes off him. He definitely stands out. Suddenly, a hand grabs her shoulder. Tracy pulls herself in with Kim close behind and they start dancing to the band. Juice spilling over the brim of her cup. Sara stays by the wall, afraid of getting any spilled on her.

direction.raw_text: (yells over the music) Why aren't you dancing?

direction.raw_text: To this?

direction.raw_text: rules the room now. Sara and Kim are dancing with others from the floor. Sara notices a speck of punch on her shirt. She stops dancing. Wets her fingers and tries to rub it out.

direction.raw_text: Crap. Kim still dances as Sara starts to look around.

direction.raw_text: Uh oh. Guys yell out. "Show em." Several hands armed with camera phones stretch out above the crowd.

direction.raw_text: Tracy. Don't. Sara slams into STEPHEN, 21, the DRUMMER from the band... who inadvertently dumps his whole beer down her shirt. Sara gasps.

direction.raw_text: To spill beer on you so I can start a conversation.

direction.raw_text: You pissed? She looks at him. Pretty good looking. Goofy smile. It's hard to be mad at him. She then grabs a beer out of a dancing partier's hand and dumps it on Stephen.

direction.raw_text: I'll get over it. He laughs, making her smile.

direction.raw_text: It's pretty good. She drinks some more.

direction.raw_text: Stephen. By the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara.

direction.raw_text: Old man.

direction.raw_text: Ugh. You're in this frat? He jokingly untwirls her away and she bumps into people behind her. Sara laughs as she notices Kim, dancing, Holding up a cup of punch.

direction.raw_text: I'm the worst roommate ever. Kim goes back to dancing Sara looks a little worried which Stephen notices.

direction.raw_text: I got her.

direction.raw_text: . She struggles to hold Tracy up -- the girl's heavier than she looks and Sara's balance is not so great, herself. The frat boys notice her struggling.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We met last night.

direction.raw_text: So... here we are. Design 101. And each one of you is asking yourself the same question... (he taps his own chest) Who is this guy? Why should I turn off my Blackberry and pay attention to him? Mild laughter from the class.

direction.raw_text: I mean.. .who doesn't have a Facebook page?! Rebecca laughs.

direction.raw_text: Okay, okay. I'll get one. Tracy knocks on the partially open front door... and marches right in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cancel those library plans. Guess who made the guest list at Rebar? (BEAT) You guys in? I trust you have fake IDs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you do. Thanks to my badass self.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Tracy pulls out a fake ID. She walks to Rebecca and holds it out to her. A peace offering. Rebecca stares at Tracy for a beat... then goes back to her sketchbook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll pass. Clubs really aren't my scene. Tracy stands there, hung out to dry, the ID in her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A posh Los Angeles bar. Loud and packed to the gills with mostly young students. Sara and Tracy stand at the bar, getting jostled, looking like... two naive college kids. As they try to get the bartender's attention, older guys check them out, smiling and mouthing "Hi." Sara tries to ignore them, but Tracy's in heaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How great is this? No parents. No curfews.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No shit! They clink their empty glasses in a toast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I? She puts her wallet and cell phone into Tracy's purse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too bad Rebecca blew us off. Talk about the life of the party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's just a little hard to get to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah right...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . As Tracy rolls her eyes... The BARTENDER sets two drinks down in front of them. He nods down the bar at...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Tracy flashes them a smile. Sara's not so sure about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think... Tracy raises her shot glass. She and Sara clink and drink. Tracy waves at the suits again. Thanks guys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can do better. She takes Sara's hand and pulls her out onto the dance floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara and Tracy whirl in the hot mix of bodies. Having the time of their lives. A HANDSOME GUY moves in, his eyes on Tracy. Tracy loves it. They dance together as Sara watches, smiling. Tracy and the handsome guy drift further away from Sara. Sara is now dancing by herself. A GUY moves in on her, but she politely dances away. She scans the dance floor for Tracy. Where'd she go? She steps off the dance floor and scans the bar -- no sign of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara walks into the crowded ladies' room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bummed Sara walks out of the club alone. She rubs her arms against the chill. She nervously tugs on her silver chain as she scans the STRAGGLERS loitering outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy. She takes one last peek into the club doorway, hoping against hope that Tracy will magically appear. No luck. She starts walking down the street, away from the club. Weary and unnerved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca lies in bed, wide awake in the dark. Her cell phone rings. She stares at it. Two more rings. She picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Would you accept a collect call from... Sara Matthews?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An old school gas station on a barren corner of the city. No cars in either direction. A lone white 328i BMW with a black soft top sits next to an ancient pump. Rebecca, half asleep, climbs out and grabs the nozzle, sticking it in the fuel tank. Starts pumping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (0.S.) Can I help you out? She turns to see a 20-year-old, good-looking gas station attendant. His name tag: "Rick". Rebecca sizes him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine. Just in a hurry. She keeps pumping. Speeding it up. Rick ambles up to her, treading beyond appropriate personal space. He points to the "Full Service" sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just doing my job. She stands her ground as he places his hand over hers on the gas pump and squeezes. She looks down at his hand on top of hers. Then lets go of the pump, nudging his hand away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All done. She pulls the nozzle out of the tank and tries to place it back at the pump. He stops her. Motions to her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a little something. No, she doesn't. He, ever so gently, rubs his index finger and thumb on her cheek to remove the imaginary smudge until he lurches back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hell? His crotch is wet as gasoline drips from the nozzle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. But she does it again, holding the lever down, dousing him head to toe. He scrambles backward out of range.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry again. Rick. The nozzle's still in her hand, pouring gas in every direction. She opens her car door, grabbing a lighter. Rick's pissed. Charges towards her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You spoiled c--- He spots the lighter in her hand. Dead stop. She absentmindedly flicks it. It sparks but doesn't light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The gas is now pouring towards him. The meter on the pump is still ticking up. He scrambles again as she casually flips the lighter at him and drops the still pouring nozzle. A hint of a grin and a pitying shake of her head as she pulls out a loose hundred dollar bill. Places it on top of the pump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pussy. She gets into her car and drives off. Leaving Rick soaked in gasoline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara sits by herself in a booth by the window. Hugging a cup of hot, sobering coffee. Rebecca's car pulls up into a parking spot. The headlights shine right in Sara's eyes... and now turn off. Sara's tired eyes light up as she sees Rebecca get out of the car. She waves. Rebecca doesn't wave back as she heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca walks up to Sara's booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. (BEAT) So, where's Tracy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No idea, I couldn't find her. Rebecca sits down, dropping her purse and keys on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As long as I'm here... you hungry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Starved. Sara smiles gratefully. Rebecca opens the menu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe she ran out on you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Thanks for coming. Rebecca looks up from the menu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy had her shot tonight. Tomorrow you're all mine. I'll show you the big city.. .the right way. And I promise I won't abandon you. Deal? Sara smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca leads Sara through the sculpture room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are the modern pieces. A little wilder than the old stuff. She's a savvy tour guide, confident, at ease. She doesn't just walk past pieces -- she studies them. Sara's impressed. Sara's cell phone buzzes. She checks the display: "Jason". She tilts it so that Rebecca can see and rolls her eyes. She buries her cell phone in her purse. Sara spots a bizarre metal structure and walks over to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I have no idea what this is supposed to be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even I don't get that one. Come on, I want to show you something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca shows Sara into a room full of paintings. In the background is a banner announcing an upcoming Richard Prince exhibition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They stop in front of Richard Prince's "Nurse of Greenmeadow." It's a portrait of a woman in a nurse's mask. Her eyes peer directly at the viewer. Blood is smeared on her smock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my favorite. Sara steps closer to examine it. Rebecca stays behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love how he captures her personality through her eyes. It's like she really wants to help you. Rebecca's hands tug anxiously at her shirt. She really wants Sara to like this painting. Sara moves even closer. She squints, trying to see what Rebecca sees. The woman's expression in the painting is actually pretty sinister. Sara's a little freaked out... but she turns to see Rebecca's hopeful expression. Sara brightens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amazing. I love it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara and Rebecca window shop along a block of thrift stores. Sara spots a graffiti-laden wall next to a tattoo parlor. Some first-rate tagging here -- bright colors, funky shapes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is so cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No graffiti in Des Moines?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. "Bobby loves Jenny. Chrissy loves Rick." Nothing like this. Rebecca pulls out her camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, smile. Sara poses... but now grabs Rebecca and pulls her in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They both hold the camera, extended at arm's length. Rebecca clicks. She looks at the picture. She can see the tattoo parlor in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now that's one "art form" I don't get. Needles into skin? No thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a tattoo. Rebecca smiles. Yeah, right. But she can see in Sara's eyes that she's serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? Sara pulls down her shirt and sweater a bit to reveal, over her heart, a simple tattoo: "Emily".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My older sister. She died when I was nine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pats her heart) This keeps her with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I always wanted a sister. Sara smiles and interlocks her arm with Rebecca's as they walk down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara sits on her bed in sweats, typing on her laptop. Rebecca sits on her own bed, glancing over at Sara as she draws.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess who I'm listing as my favorite artist on my Facebook page? (BEAT) Richard Prince. Rebecca smiles, genuinely touched. She walks over to check out the rest of Sara's Facebook Favorites. Favorite book, favorite band, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your favorite movie is "Coyote Ugly"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't laugh. It's about a small town girl making it in the big city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't every movie?! They both laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara, in shorts and warm-up jacket, runs down the sidewalk. Her head's on a swivel, taking in the city sights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca takes down a few of her drawings. In their place, she puts up a big "Coyote Ugly" poster. She straightens it out. Satisfied. She checks her watch and walks to the window. She looks out, anxious for Sara to come home. She looks over at Sara's side of the room. Curious, she starts perusing her things. Books... CDs... She walks to Sara's dresser and picks up the picture of Emily. She tenderly brushes Emily's face with her thumb. She spots Sara's silver chain. She picks it up and places it around her neck. She fingers it carefully and looks at herself in the mirror. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara finishes off her run strong, striding out the last ten yards to the dorm. She catches her breath and hears a kitten. Sara looks in-between the columns outside the dorm and finds a STRAY KITTEN. She's cute as they come, a black-and-white furball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The kitten purrs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at you. She kneels and pets it. The kitten purrs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No collar, baby? Sara glances around to see if anyone is watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara quickly walks in and closes the door. Rebecca sits in her windowsill, drawing. Sara sits down on her own bed. She notices the "Coyote Ugly" poster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you'd like it. Rebecca sees the moving bulge under Sara's jacket. She cuts Sara a look. Sara sighs. Apprehensively, she unzips her jacket and the kitten pops out. Rebecca sits up. The kitten jumps over to her bed. She pets it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, I know. It's stupid, and I've just broken about forty different dorm rules, and I should just take it to a shelter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want to name it? Sara's face lights up. She smiles gratefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll be our secret. Just between us. Rebecca keeps petting the kitten. Getting more attached.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I named her in the elevator. Cuddles. She smiles and scoops her up. Suddenly, her smile vanishes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that my necklace? Rebecca touches it. She'd forgotten she still had it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. I was just trying it on. Sara puts down the kitten and walks to Rebecca, who quickly takes it off. Sara takes it back, annoyed. She rubs it protectively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was my sister's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Sara looks at it a moment longer. She looks at Rebecca.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can borrow anything of mine. Except for this. Okay? It's the only thing I kept of hers. Rebecca nods. Sara sits down on the bed next to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm really sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. You didn't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you two close?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. You're the first roommate I've had since she died. So, it feels a little odd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a good way or a bad way? Sara smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A good way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Establishing of life at the quads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cool college hangout lined with old wooden tables and comfy couches. More like a living room than a coffee shop. Lots of laid-back STUDENTS and... One stressed-out Sara, dropping drinks off at a table and now rushing back to the register for the next order. Her CO- WORKER, clearly stoned, moves in slow motion. Not a care in his world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanted a mocha smoothie, right? O.K. Do you know what's in that? The kid shrugs. Sara hops to the blender and guesses some ingredients. She starts it up. She takes her hand off the lid, and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: splashing mocha smoothie all over her apron. She's frozen in shock. The co-worker casually hands her a towel. She snatches it. She turns to find...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: standing at the front of the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This seems like a pattern. Sara smiles. She's psyched to see him, in spite of the havoc. She leans in and speaks quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just because I kissed you doesn't mean I'll let you cut in line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what does it mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She coyly shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, the gentlemen of Psi Upsilon are reviving a sacred tradition tonight. Sara stares at him blankly. He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're having another keg party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .. dunno. I'm still having flashbacks from the last one. Sara laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what? How about if I use you as my excuse not to go. Sara smiles, bits of smoothie dripping from her apron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara walks off the elevator, still sky-high. She walks through the lounge, where Tracy sits on the couch. A television plays in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Sara thinks about ignoring her but stops. Her tone is cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Psi U. tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you can ditch me again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara... the guy had a Porsche. And a hot tub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's your apology? Tracy jumps up and walks over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I meant to say is -- I'm sorry
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I totally screwed up. Down the hall, we see Rebecca open her door and peek out. She watches Tracy and Sara. Tracy gives Sara sad, puppy dog eyes. Sara laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I forgive you. Tracy gives her a big, exaggerated hug. Over Sara's shoulder, she spots Rebecca looking at them. Tracy flashes a big smile. Relief at making up with Sara. But that's not how Rebecca takes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you're on your own at Psi U. Because... (DRAMA BUILDING) Someone has a date. Rebecca hears this. She slips back into the room and closes the door. Sara turns and walks down the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara walks in to find Rebecca slipping into a black dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look... nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. Richard Prince is having a showing. I bought two tickets. (BEAT) Since he's your favorite artist...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, I... sort of have a date?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Okay. Major downer. Rebecca goes back to getting dressed. Heavy silence in the room. Sara watches her. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I could reschedule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (being a martyr) You don't have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to. On one condition... Sara pulls a cute jacket from her closet and puts it on Rebecca. They both look at Rebecca in the mirror. Wow. Rebecca smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love it, who's the designer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you, a label whore?! Who cares ...I got it at a flea market and it looks great with the dress. Rebecca nods in agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It just needs one last touch... She grabs a pair of small, gold hoop earrings from her dresser. She places them in Rebecca's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna jump in the shower, then we'll head out. She grabs her stuff and hurries out the door. Rebecca eyes the earrings in her palm. She turns towards the full-length mirror behind the door. As she leans into the mirror, we see that her ears aren't pierced. She takes one of the earrings and touches the pin against the skin of her right lobe. After a moment of hesitation...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A small pop. She flinches. Blood trickles down her ear onto her neck. She wipes it off with her thumb and touches the other hoop to her left ear.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SHE PUSHES THE PIN IN HARD

direction.raw_text: Sara and Rebecca at the Richard Prince showing. The paintings are all similar to the one we saw in the museum. A series of women, peering at the viewer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Rebecca wears her hair up, showing off her earrings. Every guy in the room is checking out these two babes. But Rebecca's into the art, and Sara is texting Stephen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : "sorry. next time : (" Rebecca notices and frowns. Sara puts the phone away and starts studying the paintings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's night and there's not a soul in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We track slowly down the empty hallway, towards the door to the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara sleeps peacefully. Cuddles lies on top of her, awake. Her eyes glowing in the dark. Creepy. But not as creepy as... Rebecca in the other bed. She's staring back at the kitten. Envy in her eyes. Of Cuddles... or of Sara? Rebecca removes the covers and quietly gets out of bed. She walks over to Sara's bed... but not to pet Cuddles. She stands directly above Sara. Looking down at her. If Sara would simply open her eyes, she'd see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy is passed out in her bed. She stirs as she wakes. She reaches around her, slapping her end table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Water. I need water. She stumbles to the mini-fridge and looks in: Empty. She groans. She grabs an empty cup... opens her door... And lets out a sharp little scream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca sits right across from Tracy's door, her back against the wall. Staring at Tracy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca? What are you doing? Rebecca cocks her head at Tracy, as if she's trying to comprehend her. A beat. She stands... and walks to her. Tracy takes a step back, shaken by Rebecca's calm, morose demeanor. Rebecca stares right into her eyes. She makes a slight move towards Tracy, who flinches. Rebecca turns and walks down to her room. At her door, she turns and smiles. She disappears into her room. Tracy stands there, spooked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VIEW of Sara and Rebecca walking to class. Tracy walks ten yards behind them, waiting until... Rebecca and Sara wave "goodbye" to each other and head down different paths. Tracy hurries after Sara and catches up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. How was the party? Are you still the beer bong queen? But Tracy's in no mood to joke. She pulls Sara to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen... something is up with your roommate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was outside my room this morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doing what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Waiting for me. I opened my door... and there she was. Just sitting there, staring. Like some psycho.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't believe me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's just... why would she do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you ask her? I've gotta go...I'll see ya later. Tracy stops and watches Sara as she continues on. Tracy turns to go the other way, but before she leaves her eyes catch Rebecca standing in front of a nearby building. Rebecca stares at Tracy much like she did in the hallway. Tracy leaves in a hurry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara sits in her Design class. Professor Roberts stands at the podium. Three white design mannequins behind him, each sporting a different fashion style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Contrary to popular opinion, beauty is not in the eye of the beholder. It's in the hands of the designer. Sara listens intently, soaking it all in. Her cell buzzes with a text message. She discreetly takes a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who can tell me the difference between fashion and style?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : "4th & ford. be there now." Sara smiles at the message. Professor Roberts notices Sara looking at her cell phone and calls on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Matthews? Without missing a beat, Sara replies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fashion's something you can buy, but style you either have or you don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. All the money in the world can't buy you style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it can buy you a good stylist. The class chuckles. Professor Roberts smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara comes out of the building, texting on her cell as she walks. Rebecca is waiting, holding two cups of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. How'd you know when my class got out? Rebecca shrugs, playing it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm your roommate. Sara smiles and grabs a cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk through the quads. Other students are around, some strolling leisurely, others rushing to get to class.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen... Tracy told me something kinda weird. She says you... scared her this morning. Rebecca stops and looks at Sara. She starts laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's more like she scared me. She was racing to the bathroom like she was gonna hurl. She almost knocked me over. A beat as Sara ponders it all. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl does like to party. Anyway, I wouldn't worry about it. Rebecca takes a victory sip as Sara gets another text from Irene: "where r u?!?!?!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta go meet Irene. (raises her cup) Thanks for the coffee. Rebecca watches her walk off. She takes another sip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara gets out of a cab. She looks up at a big building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara walks through a design studio. Models and make-up artists are rushing around, dragging thousands of dollars worth of dresses. Sara loves the place's chaotic energy. She knocks on an open door and sees a YOUNG MODEL being worked on by a designer who isn't much older. IRENE, 28.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mouth full of pins) Finally. She gets up to hug Sara. Nearly tearing the dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Irene is putting a dress together on a MODEL. Sara watches in awe. An OLDER DESIGNER walks by... checks on Irene's work... nods his approval... and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I so want to be you when I grow up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, I wanna be me when I grow up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's going to be a star. Irene rolls her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, your dad left me four messages last week. Making sure I'm looking out for his baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh god. I hope you told him I'm closing down the library every night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told him I haven't seen you. And that for all I know you're a crack ho by now. Even the model laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perfect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara walks along, looking for a table. She spots Stephen sitting by himself. Drumming on his leg with a pencil. Ignoring the open textbook in front of him. She sits down across from him. They both smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't seen you around too much since you blew me off for dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry again. Actually, how about dinner tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hellllo. I'm studying. She takes his book. He's on page two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Page two? Busted!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but it's really dense. Off Sara's smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kim exits the bathroom and passes Tracy coming the other way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's it goin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Tracy, wearing just a towel, and brushing her teeth as she walks, steps into the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hums to herself as she spits out the toothpaste. She removes the towel and steps into the shower, pulling the curtain closed. As she shampoos her hair... The lights go out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to be kidding me. Hey! The only light is some distorted moonlight through the window. Tracy steps out of the shower, grabbing her towel. Just as she starts to feel her way along the wall... The lights come back on. She sighs happily... sheds her towel... and steps back under the steaming water. A beat. The lights go off again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit ! She turns off the shower. A beat of silence, but now... one of the other showers turns on. What the hell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, how about turning on the light?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No response. Yet another shower turns on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's out there? Tracy, back in her towel, nervous now, feels her way along the wall again. She turns on the lights. The curtains are drawn in front of both running showers. Tracy stares at them. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it's you. She walks over to the shower. A beat. She rips away one curtain. Nothing behind it but the running shower. She turns it off. She stares at the other curtain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara thinks you're weird. She told me. She pulls back the other curtain... nothing. She turns off that shower, too. But she can still hear running water. She looks back. The curtain from her own shower is closed again. The sound of running water behind it. She walks over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not funny, Rebecca. (under her breath) Bitch. She grips the curtain. She steels herself. She yanks the curtain open to see... Just running water. Tracy shakes her head. She looks around -- no one. She slips her towel off and slips back under the water. Screw Rebecca -- she's going to finish this shower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freak. Just as the warm water starts to relax her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pile-driven by Rebecca. The curtain comes right off the rings. Tracy is slammed against the shower wall. She hits the floor hard, with Rebecca on top of her. Water pelting them both.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE SHOWER CURTAIN CRASHES OVER HER,

direction.raw_text: . Rebecca clamps a hand over Tracy's mouth and pins her against the wall. The shower curtain covers her from the neck down. Tracy -- wide-eyed and terrified -- stares at Rebecca.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Sara thinks I'm weird? Let me tell you what I think. I think you're a little whore, and a bad influence on her. And I think that if you tell anyone about... what I'm about to do... you'll regret it. Rebecca, one hand still on Tracy's mouth, slides her other hand beneath the shower curtain. Tracy's eyes widen further. Rebecca finds what she's looking for... gets the grip she needs... and violently jerks her hand out of the curtain. A muffled scream from Tracy. Tears stream down her face. Rebecca stands. As Tracy sobs quietly on the shower floor, Rebecca looks down at... The bloody ring in her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice belly ring. She tosses it to Tracy... and walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara and Stephen are sitting on a couch. His arm around her shoulder, lightly playing with the ends of her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to flunk my test tomorrow, thanks to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then let's make sure it was worth it. She gives him a slow, lingering kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duh, joke's on you. I was going to flunk anyway. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca sits on her bed, petting Cuddles, blood still on her fingers, humming the tune that Tracy was humming in the bathroom. She hears steps and voices in the hallway. She smiles -- must be Sara. She quickly turns off the light and pretends to sleep. But the steps pass her door and keep going. Not Sara. She turns on the light. Worry in her eyes. She picks up her cell phone and dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara and Stephen step off the elevator. Time to say goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for helping me... not study.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anytime. He kisses her. Sweet and tender. Until... Sara sees Rebecca. Standing just five feet away. Staring at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where were you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I kept calling and calling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. I turned my cell off at the library and forgot to turn it back on. (FRAZZLED) Rebecca... this is Stephen. He flashes a smile. Rebecca doesn't even look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to bed now. I'm glad you're okay. She walks out of the lounge. A beat. That was awkward. Sara bites her lip, as if to say: "What can you do?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a curfew?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, she's right...I shoulda called. He smiles -- no big deal. He kisses her and steps into the elevator. They look at each other, waiting for the ancient doors to close. Stephen steps forward and sneaks in one more kiss. The doors close. Sara smiles; what a night. She glances down toward her door and sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara and Rebecca walk in silence, sipping their coffees. Rebecca looks straight ahead, listening to her Walkman. As they reach the fork in the path...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I'll see you later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara... (SHE TURNS) Last night. I was just worried about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't need to worry about me. I can take care of myself. Okay? Rebecca slowly nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara. We're good, right? A beat. Sara nods and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara and Stephen at a table, books spread around them. Stephen is reading Rolling Stone. Sara's on her laptop, checking her Facebook page. She gets a message for adding a new friend... from Rebecca. She clicks to add her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca sits in a chair on the other side of the library. Unbeknownst to Sara and Stephen, Rebecca watches them through the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara clicks onto Rebecca's Facebook page. She's listed only one friend: Sara. She's posted the picture of her and Sara in front of the graffiti wall. And some of her drawings. And a picture of a pretty brunette teenager, captioned "Maria." Sara looks at Rebecca's interests. Favorite Artist: Richard Prince. Favorite Passion: Drawing. Favorite movie: Coyote Ugly. Sara smiles. Best Friend: SARA. Her smile fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm already her best friend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a little sad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop. But the look on her face says she agrees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe she REALLY likes you...if you know what I mean. She looks at him quizzically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't. He just looks at her, raising his eyebrows suggestively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You... are...a...moron. He grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca watches Stephen kiss Sara, her expression is tough to read. Is she jealous... or entranced? Sara gets up and leaves. Stephen goes to the stacks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen, alone, searches for a book among the remote stacks. The stacks are massive and endless -- row after row of them. Stephen thumbs through books, not finding the one he needs. He drops a book and bends down to pick it up. Over his shoulder, we see...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the space between the shelves. She's in the next aisle over. Stephen replaces the book. He walks down the aisle, looking at the numbers of the books. Rebecca mimics his pacing as she follows him down her aisle. Her hands gently brush against the books, her eyes on Stephen. He turns in her direction and stops in his tracks. So does Rebecca. She's completely still. Stephen walks over. He puts his hand on the book that covers Rebecca. He's about to pull it out and reveal her. But it's not the right one. He keeps walking. He reaches the end of his aisle... and Rebecca the end of hers. She's right around the corner from him. He reads the markers at the end of the aisle, trying to figure out which direction to go. Rebecca's hands are sweaty. She's nervous. Does she want to get caught? Stephen turns right, away from her, and starts down the next aisle. Rebecca softly exhales. And now whispers to herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen. Stephen stops dead. Did he hear something? Guess not. He keeps going, scanning the book numbers again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, wrong aisle. He doubles back, and turns into Rebecca's aisle. But it's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We hear a door close in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen and Sara walk on a tree-lined path. Holding hands. He checks his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should we head back home? They walk by a small playground comprised of the slide, jungle gym, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The question is "whose home?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmm...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll make you a bet. I go back to your place or you take me home to my twin bed and roommate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the bet? She eyes the jungle gym.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara and Stephen are each hanging from the jungle gym. This has been going on for a few minutes. Both straining. Stephen's worse off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is kind of a stupid bet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you agree?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apparently, I'm kind of a stupid guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Making me laugh isn't going to help you. They stare each other down. She's stifling a laugh, much more in control as Stephen is straining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He tries to swing his legs and kick her. She avoids him. He catches a peek at her bare midriff. Finally, this makes him fall. She then lets go, victorious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was a gymnast until I hit a growth spurt my freshman year. Stephen brushes himself off. Dejected that he was "this close". She walks up to him. Cocky. Gives him a playful shove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I win. He gives her a playful shove back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So. She seductively walks back towards him. Takes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...let's go back to your place. She gives him a seductive grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca sketches in her bed. She looks at the clock: 1:00 a.m. And no Sara. History is repeating itself.. .and Rebecca's pissed. She rips out her sketch page and throws it away. She starts pacing the floor. She angrily moves Sara's chair back to her side. She whips out her phone and eyes the dial button. She starts to dial... but kills the call. She picks up her sketchpad again. Suddenly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from Sara's desk. Rebecca pulls out the desk drawer and finds Sara's cell phone. On the call screen:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A long beat. She pushes the talk button... but just listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Sara?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmmm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Sara, you answered. Thank you. Can we talk... about us? Rebecca's eyes clear. She's in control again. She sits down on Sara's bed, tossing Cuddles roughly to the floor. And now she lies down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss you. She moves her hand across her stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (RELIEVED) You do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you, Jason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I.. . want you, too. But... Rebecca's hand moves toward her panties.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss touching you. Do you miss touching me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Like you wouldn't believe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prove it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FRAT HOUSE - HALLWAY - NIGHT Sara and Stephen slam along the walls, in a fever. Kissing madly, missing each other's mouths. At his door... he cracks it open and peeks inside. His room is a disaster. Definitely a new world record for empty beer cans, pizza boxes, and strewn clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just give me thirty seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're kidding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . But he slips into the room and closes the door behind him. Sara leans back against the wall. Flushed, breathing hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen is a whirlwind. He tosses everything -- beer cans, clothes, study papers -- into one big garbage bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (through the door) I'm going to start taking my clothes off out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, right. He's not quite buying it... but he's cleaning faster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Oops! There goes my shirt... She's got his attention now. He speeds up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I don't believe you. (WORRIED) Wait, goddamnit, that's supposed to be my strip tease.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) There go the jeans. He's popping breath mints... while clearing off his bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just going to put your clothes back on and make you strip again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hmmm. What's next? Top or bottom? Stephen stops and stares at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara stands there, fully dressed. She looks down the empty hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who do we have here? Hey guys! Let me ask you. Bra or panties? Bra? Okay, okay. Just calm down. The door swings open. Stephen stands in front of her, grinning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew you didn't have the guts. She flicks her bra at his face. He catches it, shocked. He tosses it aside and yanks her into the room. The door slams shut behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca is breathing harder and faster now. Still holding the phone, from which we hear Jason's moans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say my name, Jason. Until I tell you to stop. She puts the phone on speaker and lays it on the pillow beside her. Both her hands ease back under the covers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Sara... Sara... Sara... Rebecca writhes, eyes closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara and Stephen make out in bed, half-naked. He lies on top of her. Looking into her eyes. Sweet and intimate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca writhes and moans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Sara... Sara... They moan together. Louder and louder... and now they finish. A long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (catching his breath) Jesus, Sara. That was incredible. Rebecca smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I miss you so much. Her smile dies. She picks up the phone. A cruel gleam in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't ever call me again. She kills the call. And now deletes it from the phone log.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carnegie Dorm on a bright, clear morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara, hair mussed up but eyes shining. Sara opens her door and steps in. She's tentative, expecting Rebecca to jump down her throat. But Rebecca smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, good morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Sorry I didn't call. I forgot my phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No problem. Sara opens her desk drawer and grabs her phone. She quickly checks. No calls. Rebecca looks Sara over and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on...don't I get any details??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A nice girl doesn't kiss and tell. They laugh. A nice, easy vibe between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to go get some breakfa-- Before she can finish, Cuddles bolts out the door and down the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no. Sara chases after her as Rebecca gets up from her bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara turns the corner to see... The resident assistant, with Cuddles cradled in her arms. Sara apprehensively walks up to him. R.A. Is this your cat, Sara?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe... R.A. She's cute... She nods as she gingerly takes Cuddles from his arms. She turns to walk back to the room. R.A. And if you keep her, I lose my job. Do we understand each other? She stops. Turns. Looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Sara walks back to her room. Rebecca stands in the doorway. They exchange despondent looks. Screwed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Irene opens the door and Sara walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What took you so long?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I walked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's ten bucks for a cab and I'm a student.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara! You can't just walk around downtown L.A. at night. This is not Des Moines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously, listen to me. That's why I own a gun. Sara's shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely! Big cities are crawling with crazies. Sara moves into the apartment. Her phone rings. She answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Oh, Hi. Yeah, I'm over at Irene's. I meant to leave you a note. Uh huh, uh huh, oh! That's a good idea. Let me check, hold on. Sara covers the phone and turns to Irene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you like cats?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to get rid of one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't. Travel too much. Poor thing would starve to death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right. (back into phone) No, she can't. Huh? Oh I don't know... whenever I get there. Bye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My roommate. More than a little overprotective.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's no fun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, where is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said you had a surprise for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah. I went through my closet. There's nothing here I've worn in the past six months. Irene walks toward the couch where there's a pile of clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're kidding, all of these?! Oh no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What ...what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have no closet space at the dorms. Rebecca's already using half of mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God, I just had the best idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you move in here with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'm never here. The place is huge. Ditch the roommate. And, the building allows pets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh. Let me talk to Rebecca about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. (BEAT) So, how's Jason? I really liked him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We broke up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah ...he sucked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - LATER Sara stuffs her new clothes into her tiny closet. The bags spill out into the room, taking up floor space. Rebecca sits on her bed, her laptop open. She's staring at Irene's Facebook Profile. There are some racy pictures of Irene and some girlfriends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. What're those?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Irene gave them to me. She had a lot more but we don't have the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too bad she couldn't take Cuddles, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, maybe that's not a problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. She actually suggested that I move in with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? (BEAT) You want to move?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, of course not. I love living here... with you. Sara smiles as she sits down next to Rebecca, trying to put a bright spin on things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I'd still technically be living here. So you wouldn't have to get a new roommate. Her place is huge and it's not like you couldn't use the extra closet space. I'd just move some of my stuff over, and spend a few nights a week there. We'd both have a lot more space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want more space. I want... She checks herself. A beat of awkward silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing's set in stone. It's just something to think about. Plus we'd be able to keep Cuddles. As Sara hangs more new clothes in her closet, Rebecca stares across the room at... Cuddles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Sara crosses the quads, she spots Tracy up ahead, walking by herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy! Tracy slows for a split-second, then keeps walking. As if she didn't hear anything. Sara hurries to catch up with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy... hey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hey. Tracy smiles, but weakly. The girl's lost all her sparkle. Her eyes dart around nervously, like a bird's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard you changed dorms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Conrad Hall. Seemed like a better vibe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we should get together. Like grab a bite or something. Right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Sara! Sara turns and waves at Rebecca.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Rebecca starts to walk over to Tracy and Sara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll call you. But she's already walking away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. She just walked away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, she's always been a flake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara whips up a latte for a customer, her cell phone to her ear. She's really got the hang of this job now. In charge, moving with a purpose. She snatches an issue of High Times from her co-worker's hand and points him toward the sink. He starts washing blenders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. I do so call, Mom. Geez. Her latte customer rolls his eyes. Moms. He takes his drink and walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, actually, I was thinking I'd do Thanksgiving here and see you guys for Christmas. She listens, her face telling us that she doesn't like what she's hearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya know what, I'm at work, and I'm really getting slammed... There isn't another customer in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll call you later, okay? Tell Dad I said hello. Bye. She hangs up the phone and sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca gathers her laundry into a giant duffle bag. As she carries it toward the door, she passes Cuddles, curled up on Sara's bed. She scoops her up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like it's just you and me tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca walks downstairs, down the hallway to the laundry room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca waits for her clothes to finish drying. Cuddles plays with a sock on top of a nearby washer. Rebecca checks on her clothes. They're dry, with two minutes still left on the timer. She stuffs the clothes into her duffle bag. She walks to the washers and picks up Cuddles. She pets her gently. She walks back to the dryer and places Cuddles inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See how nice and warm it is in there? Cuddles seems to enjoy the warmth. Rebecca closes the door and watches the confused kitten paw at the glass. She gently pushes the start button, just enough to get the dryer moving for a sec. Cuddles stumbles, falls over, and gets back up. Rebecca pushes the button again, a little longer this time. Cuddles stumbles. Flips over. The dryer beeps. OUT OF TIME. Cuddles meows at Rebecca, wanting out. She reaches into her pocket... and pulls out her last quarter. She gently places it in the slot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 15 MINUTES. Rebecca stares through the glass at the kitten. She fingers the button. Before she pushes it -- CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara walks in to find Rebecca sprawled on her bed, crying. She rushes over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, what's wrong? Rebecca looks up at her, eyes red. Ashamed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cuddles got out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no. In the dorm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was doing laundry... I took her with me... She jumped out of the bag and ran outside. I went after her, but... (WHIMPERS) I'm so sorry. Sara stands, pissed. She wants to really go off on Rebecca... but the girl's so distraught, so fragile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe she'll come back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to go find her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want me to help? But Sara's already gone, slamming the door behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara and Rebecca sit alone at a table. Eating quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it's... just karma or something. We weren't allowed to keep her anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not mad at me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was an accident. (BEAT) It's just... stress after stress, you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is something else wrong? A beat as Sara decides whether to confide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My parents really want me to come home for Thanksgiving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want to go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not exactly the most festive holiday in the Matthews household. (BEAT) Emily died two days before Thanksgiving. A beat. Rebecca pats Sara's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know I should be there with them, but it's like there's a ghost at the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can come with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Rebecca sits up, her excitement growing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, spend Thanksgiving at my house.

direction.raw_text: Your folks wouldn't mind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. Like they'd even notice.

direction.raw_text: Okay, we'll see. Thanks.

direction.raw_text: Professor Roberts stands at the blackboard, wrapping up a lecture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your midterm designs are due Friday. Remember, class: Simplicity. Who founded our industry? Eve -- when she handed Adam that fig leaf. Students laugh on their way out the door. As Sara walks past Roberts...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara. Could I see you in my office, please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. I've got a class right now. But I'll come right after it.

direction.raw_text: Sara knocks on Professor Roberts' open door. She steps into his office. It's small and intimate, with books stacked along every wall. Scraps of fabric are pinned to cork boards. Roberts smiles at her from his chair. He walks to the door and closes it. He walks back, pulls a chair close to hers, and sits down. She crosses her legs, her knees accidentally brushing against his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think I need to tell you how impressed I've been with your work. (BEAT) Every year I go to Fashion Week in Paris. It's dazzling. The photo shoots... the parties... that incredible runway. When the first model bursts through the curtain and hits that catwalk? Sara, a roar goes up from that crowd that's like... nothing you've ever heard. (BEAT) The college allows me to take one student. All expenses paid. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Full backstage access. Usually, it's a senior. (BEAT) But it doesn't have to be. Sara's pulse is racing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure I understand. Are you saying what I think you're saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm saying you have a shot. You'd have to earn it, Sara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. I'll do... anything. Roberts stands and walks to the window. He looks out at the quad... and now turns back to Sara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to see more danger in your work. Your designs are always crisp; they're always clear. But they're a little... safe. That stung. Sara can't keep the red from rising in her face. Roberts walks over to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be afraid to go to some of the... He delicately taps her temple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: darker places in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... He squats beside her, his hand on her shoulder now. He looks into her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The best designers push the boundaries of what's... acceptable. They take chances. Do you like to take chances, Sara?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So do I. He kisses her. Sara pushes him away, jumping out of her chair. She stands in front of him, shaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe you just did that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I took a chance, that's all. With a student that I trust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I better go. Sara grabs her books. As she heads for the door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paris, Sara. Fashion Week. Don't blow the chance of a lifetime. She hurries out of the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca sits alone at a study table. Sara walks up and drops down her books. THUD. Students look over from other tables. Sara doesn't care. She sits down and stares blankly into space, trying to forget what just happened. Rebecca leans over, concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My design professor just kissed me. Rebecca turns very serious. She gets up and sits down next to Sara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you alright? Sara nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it just really creeped me out. And I think the asshole's married.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Rebecca puts her hand on Sara's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Professor Roberts at his desk, set to call it a day. He tosses some design sheets into his briefcase. He opens a desk drawer... grabs his wedding ring... and slips it onto his finger. He hears FOOTSTEPS in the hallway. The sexy, unmistakable clicking of a woman's heels. They come closer... and now stop at his door. Roberts watches the door, waiting for a knock. Nothing. He walks to it. He can see the silhouette of two feet at the bottom of the door. He smiles -- Sara, coming back to him. He opens the door, revealing: Rebecca. She wears a snug v-neck cardigan, skin-tight black jeans, and silver stiletto heels. A small purse on her shoulder. Roberts swallows his surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Professor Roberts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad I caught you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, I was just... But Rebecca steps past him into the office, her heels snapping on the worn hardwood floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roberts, a little annoyed but also intrigued, follows her back inside. They face each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not one of my students.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not yet. That's why I'm here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She steps to his desk and leans against it. Her cool manner is disarming. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm failing Intro Pysch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And why is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I'm bored. I thought it would be all about Freud, and deep dark secrets. But it's brain chemistry. Synapses. I can't stay awake in class.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry to hear that. But I'm not sure what I can do to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow's the last day to drop a course without penalty. Unless I can add another one in its place, I'll fall way behind in credits. Daddy won't take that very well. He might even pull the plug. Which means... (BEAT) I'm pretty much at your mercy, Professor. Roberts smiles. This girl is a trip. Is she for real? She's so calm, so steady. Roberts can't get a handle on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I've always made it a policy not to accept any students this late in the term.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I look like just any student to you? She smiles... and eases up onto his desk. Facing him. Pretty feet dangling, ankles locked. Jesus. She eases her purse off her shoulder and onto the desk. She sees the framed picture of a WOMAN AND TWO KIDS. She picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your wife is very pretty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ex-wife . The game is on now. Roberts slowly walks around the desk, until he's behind Rebecca. In the picture frame's reflection, Rebecca sees him slip off his wedding ring. He palms it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few things I'd need to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ask me anything. He's circling the desk now. Predator and prey.

direction.raw_text: Do you have any design experience?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know about clothes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only one thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I definitely look better out of them than in them. What an answer. Roberts stops in front of her. He moves in close, between her parting legs. He looks into her eyes. Still steady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we might be able to work something out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. Just tell me and I'll do anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kiss me. (BEAT) I'll take it from there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He kisses her. She opens her lips for a tantalizing second, and now gently pushes him away. He holds his ground. He's had a taste -- he wants a lot more. Suddenly, Rebecca's face hardens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ow! You're hurting me! Professor, stop!... Roberts stares at her in shock. He's not even touching her. What's going on? Rebecca smiles again. This girl is whacked. But damn, Roberts wants her. And her eyes are inviting him back. As he presses in to kiss her again... She rockets a knee into his groin and he crumples to the floor, gasping for air. He drops his wedding ring, which rolls away across the floor. Rebecca steps to the desk, where her purse sits open. We can see the Walkman inside. She takes it out. Smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Birthday gift. You should get one, they're great. She slips on the earbuds... plays with the Walkman for a few seconds... and now hits the play button. We hear their prior conversation, played back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. Just tell me and I'll do anything. (BEAT) Kiss me. I'll take it from there. (BEAT) Owl You're hurting me! Professor, stop!... Rage and betrayal in Roberts' eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bitch tease!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm not teasing. She starts to circle him now, as he writhes in pain on the floor.

direction.raw_text: Do you see enough danger in me now, Professor? Did I go to a dark enough place for you? He recognizes his own words to Sara.

direction.raw_text: What? How did?... Who are you? He lunges at her ankle. She steps out of his grasp... and slams the sharp spike of her heel down on his hand. He yells again.

direction.raw_text: She trusted you. She walks toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't do this. Twenty years. Everything I worked for. I'll pay for that tape. Rebecca stops at the door. She kneels, picks up his wedding ring, and rolls it across the floor to him.

direction.raw_text: Yes you will. She walks out the door.

direction.raw_text: Anything wrong? Sara is taken out of her own world
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you ok?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She smiles. Stephen smiles back. Sara looks down in her book again.

direction.raw_text: Sara looks up at the building. She sighs before she enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She walks slowly toward the classroom, letting other students pass her. She steps into the doorway and sees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: standing at Professor Roberts' podium. She gestures for everyone to come in. Sara, like the rest, is confused.

direction.raw_text: Welcome. I'm Professor Jacobs. I'll be taking over the class for the rest of the semester. Sara can't believe it. She takes a seat and turns to the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: next to her.

direction.raw_text: What happened?

direction.raw_text: Sara walks in with a tray, still a bit dazed. She sees a half- dozen hallmates milling about and Rebecca sitting by herself in the corner, drawing. Sara joins her.

direction.raw_text: Remember what I told you about Professor Roberts?

direction.raw_text: Yeah?

direction.raw_text: He's gone.

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?

direction.raw_text: Oh My God.

direction.raw_text: I know.

direction.raw_text: That's called Karma.

direction.raw_text: Stephen, sweaty, is behind the counter helping Sara clean up.

direction.raw_text: I've made a decision. You ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lemme hear it.

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna quit the band.

direction.raw_text: No. Really? Why?

direction.raw_text: It's a waste of time-and we suck.
