direction.raw_text: Well, let me think about this. The only places we can get booked is at my own frat house and at my girlfriend's coffee shop.

direction.raw_text: You're right. You guys do suck. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold it. Did you just say girlfriend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard me.

direction.raw_text: So you think it'll be fun to stay here during Thanksgiving?

direction.raw_text: Dinner at the frat, the football games. Don't forget the always awkward, homoerotic humor.

direction.raw_text: Sounds like a blast.

direction.raw_text: Oh. For sure.

direction.raw_text: A somber Rebecca stares at herself in the full-length mirror on the back of the front door. A very strange expression in her eyes. She looks herself over, makes a fist, and now... Punches herself on the temple. Hard. She staggers, nearly knocked out. She straightens. Looks in the mirror. Her skin is already bruising. She punches herself again. Same spot. And again, with her other fist this time. And now a shot to her shoulder. And another. It's painful to watch. But she's getting more and more numb to the blows. She inspects herself closely... and now reaches down and grabs an artist's UTILITY KNIFE. It looks like a large, retractable box cutter. She extends the blade all the way out. She pulls up her shirt. Turns to the side a bit. Places the knife against her skin and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara opens the door and finds Rebecca curled up in a fetal position in a corner of the room. Sobbing. Sara drops her things and runs over to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God. What happened? She cradles Rebecca, who buries her head in between her knees. Sara checks the bruises on her head and arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca. It's okay. You're safe now. Talk to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was looking for Cuddles. A man... pulled me into an alley. He tried... Sara holds her. She can't finish.

direction.raw_text: It's okay. It's okay. Shhh.

direction.raw_text: I got away.

direction.raw_text: You're alright now. Sara notices a streak of blood against Rebecca's shirt. She pulls it up and sees a slash. Gasps.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not deep, thank God. But you should see a doctor.

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca, you need to. And then the police.

direction.raw_text: . Rebecca pulls back on her bed, ruining the gauze job.

direction.raw_text: I don't want to. I can't. Sara pulls out her cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're calling them, or I am. There's a psycho walking around this campus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. I didn't see him. She's so frazzled, she's undoing Sara's nursing efforts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, okay. I won't call. Just let me help you. Rebecca calms down. Let's Sara finish. Watching her intently as she works.

direction.raw_text: Sorry about not staying. But, Rebecca...

direction.raw_text: I get it. (KISSES HER) I'm going to make out with my pillow and pretend it's you.

direction.raw_text: I haven't heard from Jason in weeks. It's weird how he just stopped calling.

direction.raw_text: It's what you wanted, right? Sara nods, reassuring herself.

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Yeah it is. Sara looks out the window. Rebecca shows a hint of a smile.

direction.raw_text: This is your home?

direction.raw_text: It's my parents house. It was never a home.

direction.raw_text: Rebecca and Sara walk in. Rebecca's on edge, flinching as Sara closes the door. Rebecca's parents rush in from the living room. Her father gives her an awkward hug.

direction.raw_text: We didn't think you would make it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Her mother sees the bruises on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.

direction.raw_text: Nothing? This isn't nothing.

direction.raw_text: Leave it alone. Sara is stunned. But Rebecca's parents cease. Her mom gives her a tender, protracted embrace. Rebecca endures it, barely raising her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. And you are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Sara. She puts out her hand, but cuts Rebecca a look. You didn't tell them?

direction.raw_text: Sara's my roommate.

direction.raw_text: I'm Jeff. Rebecca's mother comes over and unexpectedly embraces Sara.

direction.raw_text: It's so great to meet you, Sara. I'm Alison. Rebecca grabs Sara by the arm.

The drawings are of teenage girls -- more precisely, they're different drawings of one teenage girl. They're odd, but compelling.

direction.raw_text: These are interesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, some of my high school work. I haven't gotten around to takin them down.

direction.raw_text: Family and guest sit around a very nice, but not too large dining table. The contents of the house are expensive but not pretentious. Rebecca plays with her food, clearly not wanting to engage her parents, who are undaunted. All smiles and warmth.

direction.raw_text: Rebecca's a pretty great artist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, we think Rebecca is so talented. Rebecca shakes her head, uncomfortable with the flattery.

direction.raw_text: She's an awesome roommate, too.

direction.raw_text: (looks at his daughter,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's nice to hear and I'm sure she likes you because she never brings anyone home before. Rebecca stares at her father.

direction.raw_text: Dad!

direction.raw_text: What? As a parent you worry. You protect your daughter all her life and then she goes off to college and she's on her own. I'm just relieved she got a good roommate. Sara cuts discreet looks around the table. Who are these people?

direction.raw_text: Sara, I'll make up a room for you -- REBECCA She'll stay in my room. Sara turns to Rebecca, confused but willing to go along.

direction.raw_text: Sara and Rebecca are getting ready to sleep. Sara has made a makeshift bed in the middle of the floor.

direction.raw_text: We can share the bed if you want. Sara looks down at her own "bed" and takes a glance at the walls. On the floor, she's going to be surrounded by the drawings of Rebecca looking at her.

direction.raw_text: Sure. Sara climbs into bed with Rebecca. They lay back to back. Rebecca turns the lamp off next to the bed.

direction.raw_text: Thanks for coming.

direction.raw_text: Next Thanksgiving, you can run interference with my family.

direction.raw_text: Done. Sara closes her eyes. It's silent. Rebecca turns over. A beat. She opens her eyes -- just inches from Sara. She ever so slowly raises her hand and gently strokes Sara's hair.

direction.raw_text: . Sara opens her eyes for a second. Not sure if she felt something. She closes them again.

direction.raw_text: Jeff walks from the stairs into the pitch black kitchen. He's lived here long enough to know his way in the dark.

direction.raw_text: Jeff opens the fridge. The soft light barely illuminates Rebecca, sitting stoically at the table behind her father. Jeff jumps. He recovers, standing by the open fridge.

direction.raw_text: Becs. You scared me. Rebecca, glass of milk in her hand, gives her father a dirty look. We know how much she hates nicknames.

direction.raw_text: Sara stands at the top of the stairs. She walks down them and to the kitchen doorway. She peeks inside to see...

direction.raw_text: Rebecca and her father sitting at the table. Just the moonlight through the window falling over them. Spooky.

direction.raw_text: How're you doing?

direction.raw_text: Fine. My grades are good.

direction.raw_text: That's not what I meant. She looks down at the table.

direction.raw_text: Rebecca, look at me for a second. Now she looks at him.

direction.raw_text: I know. He doesn't know what else to say. Outside Sara sees the framed photos on the wall. Each features Rebecca's parents in some exotic locale: On the beach... on the ski slopes... on a cruise ship. They smile happily at the camera. Rebecca isn't in a single picture.

direction.raw_text: I just wanted to make sure. Good night, I'm heading back to bed. He rises. Sara turns and walks up the stairs.

direction.raw_text: Hi Sara.

direction.raw_text: Hi. Rebecca's going to show me some of her high school hangouts.

direction.raw_text: Wonderful. Alison peers up the stairs.

direction.raw_text: Rebecca seems to be doing well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uhhh, yeah. I think she is.

direction.raw_text: Is she taking her medication?

direction.raw_text: Medication? Alison turns to see... her daughter at the top of the stairs. Did she hear them? She walks down.

direction.raw_text: Hey sweetheart. She kisses her on the cheek. Rebecca is annoyed.

direction.raw_text: Ready? Sara nods, but she's still reeling from Alison's words. Medication? She looks back, but Alison waves cheerfully.

direction.raw_text: Have a great time, you two.

direction.raw_text: Is everything okay?

direction.raw_text: . COFFEE SHOP DAY Sara and Rebecca are in line for their drinks. The TEENAGE CASHIER takes their money... but keeps staring at Rebecca. She doesn't pay any attention to him. Sara takes her coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. The cashier stares at her, as if trying to figure Sara out. What's she doing with Rebecca? The girls sit at a table. The cashier and BARISTA keep glancing over, whispering to each other. Rebecca shoots them a look. Like a warning. They quiet. Start doing busy work.

direction.raw_text: I used to come here like every day after school. The door opens. THREE GIRLS walk in, laughing and chatting. One BRUNETTE spots Rebecca and stops dead in her tracks. Sara recognizes her. It's MARIA, the girl from Rebecca's Facebook, and the subject of all those wall sketches. The chatting girls all fall silent.

direction.raw_text: You know them?

Finally, the Brunette sits down at a table by the entrance. As far away from Rebecca's and Sara's table as possible. The other two girls walk to the counter. They sneak glances at Rebecca as they order their drinks. Sara looks back and forth between Rebecca and the girls. Rebecca doesn't waver. She keeps staring at the Brunette. Suddenly, Rebecca gets up.

direction.raw_text: Let's leave. Rebecca walks towards the door. Sara, confused, gathers her things and gets up. Rebecca stops at the Brunette's table. The Brunette sits there, like a deer caught in headlights.

direction.raw_text: Hello, Maria.

direction.raw_text: Hello. The other girls walk over. Rebecca, unfazed, looks them over, sending shivers down their spines. They want to back up their friend, but they look as scared as she does. Sara watches all this from a few feet away. Rebecca suddenly turns cheerful.

direction.raw_text: Hi. Rebecca keeps eyeing Maria, a superior grin on her face. An awkward beat. Everyone's tense. Sara clears her throat.

direction.raw_text: Well, we better go. Rebecca snaps out of it. Nods. They start to walk out. But as they open the door...

direction.raw_text: Sara and Irene are frantic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My phone. My phone. She nods her head and Sara sees the phone on the bed table. She rushes for it. No good the wire is cut!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The window! There's a fire escape. You can reach it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca looks around for the gun. Throwing chairs and furniture around. She finds it. Picks the gun off the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara races to the window and throws it open. There's just an empty street below. She eyes the fire escape. A nearly impossible leap away. But Sara's out of options.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara takes a tentative step out onto the slim ledge. Her foot hits a flowerpot, which plummets ten stories... and smashes to pieces in the alley. Sara shuts her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca, back at the bedroom door, raises the gun and fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door shatters, and the bullet continues straight ahead and tears a pillow open, just beside Irene's head. Feathers go flying. Irene screams. Rebecca kicks the door open and steps in, gun in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you're scared, Sara. But I promise, everything is gonna be okay. She stops short at the sight of...Sara on the ledge. Rebecca turns and stares at Irene. Fresh panic rising in Irene's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Irene. But she's my friend, not yours. She raises the gun at the helpless Irene... But out of nowhere STEPHEN, RUSHING UP FROM BEHIND, knocks her arm. The gun fires wildly, one bullet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exploding through the window, shattering it and startling Sara, who loses her balance and slips off the ledge. She grabs on by her fingertips, her face hitting the brick wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohgodohgodohgod. The more she screams, the more she loses her grip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca fires another shot, hitting a giant bedroom mirror, shattering it's reflection of Rebecca's struggle with Stephen. Rebecca slams her head into his lip, knocking him backward. He keeps hold of her, and they hit the floor, the gun flying out of Rebecca's hand. Stephen gets on top. He lifts his arm high and balls his fist before he puts it right in her face full throttle, knocking her out cold. He quickly takes the gun and puts it inside his belt as he races for the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (SCREAMING) Stephen! Help!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry!! He sees Sara dangling outside and reaches for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara's crying, barely mouthing Stephen's name. He grabs her arms. Leaning halfway outside, he starts to pull her up. Part of the way up, he holds her against his chest and lets her cry. He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay I've got you. Everything is gonna be okay! He pulls her halfway in the window... But a shadow rises behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!!! A loud unpleasant sound. THUD! Irene screams. Then Stephen stiffens, his body straightening in shock. Something's wrong. And now Sara stares in horror as... Blood runs down his face. He looks into Sara's eyes... and lets go of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She falls, but manages to hook onto the ledge as Stephen disappears from the window frame. Using the brick wall for leverage, she arduously lifts herself up into the window in time to see... Stephen, glassy-eyed, backing away from the window. He slumps to the floor, revealing: Rebecca. She's a crazed mess, hair and eyes wild. Rebecca drops the bloody fireplace poker and rushes to the window. She helps Sara in. They tumble onto the floor. Sara tosses Rebecca to the side and rushes over to Stephen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen. Stephen is out. She sees the gun in his belt. She pulls it out, spins, and levels it at Rebecca. The gun shakes violently in her hand. Rebecca stands and walks calmly towards Sara, who is still on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't do it. We're fr-- Sara pulls the trigger. Click. Rebecca stares in shock. Click. Click. Click. Click. Sara closes her eyes in frustration. She drops the gun. Tears stream down Rebecca's face. She can't believe Sara pulled that trigger. But as if flipping a switch... Rebecca's sadness turns to rage. She balls her fists, her knuckles white, and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at Sara full force, slamming her against the wall. She tosses her like a ragdoll across the room, where... Sara's head slams the nightstand, knocking the contents of Rebecca's purse everywhere. Rebecca wipes the tears from her eyes. It hurts her to hurt Sara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Friends help each other. They take care of each other. Sara, dazed and weak, stares at Rebecca.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebecca. We were never friends. That's the last straw. Rebecca comes hard, murder in her eyes. She grabs Sara around the throat, pulls her up from the floor, and slams her against the wall. She starts choking the life out of her. Sara's face turns red. Redder... But suddenly Rebecca's grip loosens. Her eyes stare in shock. Sara pulls Rebecca's hands off her neck with one hand. The utility knife is in her other hand... stuck between Rebecca's shoulder blades. Rebecca falls to the floor, bringing Sara down with her. She won't let go of Sara. As she gasps for air, she sees... Sara's tattoo, visible beneath her torn shirt. Sara self- consciously notices her looking at it. Rebecca reaches out and grabs Sara's hand. Sara lets go of her hand, and removes the necklace from around Rebecca's neck. Irene is trembling in the bed. Too shocked to say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara. She races over to him. He's barely alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen. Hold on. She finds her phone on the floor. She steps back to Stephen and cradles his head in her lap as she dials 911. He looks into her eyes and smiles. She smiles through her tears, love in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a warm, spring day. Sara, melancholy but looking in much better shape since the last time we saw her, stands in front of her dorm, looking to restart her college career. She plays with the silver chain once again around her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She opens the front door and walks in. Students milling about look at her. Know who she is. We see Kim and Tracy. They don't say anything. Don't know what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara opens the door. The simple room is identical to her previous one. She hesitates at first but then walks in. There is a box marked "SARA" filled with the things she left behind in her old dorm. There's a knock on the open door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Welcome back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. How are you feeling? Stephen enters the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better now. You being here's gonna help. Sara smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's moving in going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just got here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well let me give you some time to get settled in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, I need you right here, right now. Stephen grins. He likes where this is headed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sara and Stephen push the twin bed into the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't exactly what I had in mind. Sara grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I can get settled in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be back to pick you up for dinner. You gonna be ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely. Stephen takes off down the hall. Sara follows him with her eyes before she goes back into her room.
direction.name: direction
